column4: ok, this is frustrating, 1233 users, many or most of whom have used ndiswrapper i imagine, none of whom are prepared to even aknowledge as much or give me a few simple replies
if no one knows how to help you, no one will answer.  Try again later or try the other !support options
have you read the wiki page on wifi however?
i think so, can you link?
i read the help pages associated with the apps
the one you were using before :)  compare /boot/grub/menu.lst
how am I supposed to identify from menu.lst which is the correct one? of the two that grub lists (hd2,0 and hd3, 0) only hd2,0 is mentioned, and that appears to be a vista loader
use the one for your main system, it doesn't really matter

well there is only one gnu/linux install that I care about attached to this machine, so I can't do too much damage right? I mean if I specify the important one the I've got the right drive, and if I don't then it probably refers to a redundant install anyway that is no longer functional
should I install grub on both hd3 and hd2 just to be on the safe side? or do one at a time and reboot?
ok well I'm going to restart now and see if it worked. Thanks for your help
et.al.: that didn't work :( despite apparently succesfull grub reinstall via CLI I still get error17
